Just Cause Eviction: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Just Cause Eviction policy? These policies may also be called or mention Retaliatory Evictions. This typically involves requiring landlords or property owners to have a valid reason to evict a tenant. They may also be called good cause eviction or for cause eviction, etc.
Rent Stabilization or Rent Control: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Rent Stabilization or Rent Control policy? This typically involves limiting the amount a landlord or property owner can increase the rent of a property. They may also be called rent regulation or price controls for housing, etc.
Rent Review Board: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Rent Review Board policy? This is typically in the form of a autonomous/semi-autonomous administrative body that oversees disputes involving rent increases. They may also be called landlord and tenant board, etc.
Mobile Home Rent Control: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Mobile Home Rent Control policy? This is typically just rent control, but specificly for mobile homes(RVs, Trailers, Campers, etc.) These may also be called land lease rent control or site rent control, etc.
SRO Preservation: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a single room occupancy preservation policy? This is also known as SRO preservation or single room occupancy(SRO) retention and typically involve construction loans and grant assistance when a property owner decides to sell a SRO property. They may also be called residential hotel preservation or SRO Renewal, etc.
Condo Conversion Restrictions: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of condo conversion restrictions? This is typically done to balance the benefits of converting rental properties into condominiums by implementing tenant protections, not allowing areas of high demand to be converted, or restrict the conversion of affordable units. They may be also called rental replacement by-laws or restrictions on conversion of rental properties, etc.
Foreclosure Assistance: Are there foreclosure assistances policies in this area? A foreclosure assistance policy typically aims to help homeowners from foreclosure due to mortgage default by providing various forms of financial, or loan assistance. They may be also called loss mitigation or foreclosure prevention, etc.
Foreclosure or Homeownership Assistance: Do any policies implement a form of Foreclosure or Homeownership Assistances policy? This is typically in the form of a policy that involves local protections or support programs that help tenants or homeowners when a property goes through foreclosure. Do not include emergency foreclosure programs from COVID or coronavirus. They may also be called loss mitigation, foreclosure prevention, homeownership assistances, foreclosure assistance, relocation assistance, etc.
Affordable-Housing Linkage Fees: Do any policies implement a form of Affordable Housing Linkage Fees? This is typically in the form of a policy that involves requiring developers to contribute financially to affordable housing through fees or by providing on-site affordable units. They may just be called housing linkage fees, affordable housing impact fees, or development impact fees, etc.
Commercial Linkage Fees: Do any policies implement a form of Commercial Linkage Fees? This is typically in the form of a policy that involves requiring developers of new commercial properties to help financially fund affordable housing through fees. They may be also called job linkage fees, etc.
Housing Trust Fund: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Housing Trust Fund(HFT)? This is typically established to dedicate ongoing public revenue for affordable housing development and preservation. They may be called Community Housing Funds, Affordable Housing Funds, etc.
Inclusionary Zoning: Are there any mention of the implementation or use of a Inclusionary Zoning policy? This is typically when developers are required to include a certain percentage of affordable units in a housing property. They may also be called inclusionary housing or inclusionary planning, etc.
Density Bonus: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Density Bonus policy? This is typically a policy that involves allowing developers to build high density housing in areas they are usually not permitted in return for community benefits like affordable housing, public amenities, etc.
Community Land Trusts: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Community Land Trust (CLTs) policy, which acquire and hold land for the benefit of the community? This is typically for affordable housing reasons or other community needs. They may also be referred to generally as land trusts, etc.
First Source Hiring Program: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a First Source Hiring Program policy? This is typically a policy that prioritizes local residents or specific groups for jobs created through government assisted projects or contracts. They may also be called First Source Employment or Local Hire/Hiring Program, etc.
ADUs: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Accessory Dwelling Units (ADUs) policy? This is typically created to allow the construction of accessory dwelling units within an existing structure, as a detached structure, or a seperate unit within a new building. They may also be referred to as secondary suites, in-law suites, basement apartments, garden suites, laneway houses, or accessory apartments, etc.
Housing Overlay Zones: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Housing Overlay Zones (HOZs) policy? These typically involve adding specific regulations to existing zoning rules to encourage the development of affordable units by provding incentives to including affordable units in a property. They are different from Inclusionary Zoning policies or Density Bonus policies in that they require adherence to specific regulations while only offering benefits for compliance and not mandating it. They may also be referred to as overlay districts or zoning overlays, etc.
Land Value Recapture: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Land Value Recapture policy? These typically involve recovering and reinvesting increases in land value that result from public investment. They may also be referred to as Betterment Levy, Windfall Tax, value sharing, value recovery, etc.
Unsubsidized Affordable Housing Preserva: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Unsubsidized Affordable Housing policy? These policies typically aim to protect existing affordable housing units, not reliant on government subsidies. They may also be referred to as Naturally Occurring Affordable Housing, etc.
Subsidized Housing Preservation: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Subsidized Housing Preservation policy? These policies typically aim to protect existing affordable housing units, but are also subsidized by the municipal government. They may also be referred to as Affordable Housing Preservation, etc.
Housing Rehabilitation Programs: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Housing Rehabilitation Programs policy? These policies typically aim to assist medium/low income homeowners repair or renovate their homes. They may also be referred to as Residential Rehabilitation Program, Home Repair Program, or Homeowner Rehabilitation Assistance Program, etc.
Tenant Opportunity to Purchase: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Tenant Opportunity to Purchase (TOPA) policy? These policies typically aim to allow tenants to purchase a property when the owner decides to sell. They may also be referred to as Opportunity to Purchase, etc.
Rental Assistance Programs: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Rental Assistance Programs policy? These policies typically aim to provide financial assistance to renters in need. They may also be referred to as Tenant Support Program, etc.
Tenant Right to Counsel: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Tenant Right to Counsel (TRC) policy? These policies typically aim to guarantee legal representation for low-income tenants facing eviction. They may also be referred to as Tenant Duty Counsel Program (TDCP), etc.
Short Term Rental Ban/Limitation: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Short Term Rental (STRs) Ban/Limitation policy? These policies typically aim to balance benefits of Short Term Rentals with concerns about housing affordability and community impact. They may also be referred to as transient rental restrictions, vacation rental regulations, short-term accommodation bylaws, etc.
Pass Through Limitation: Is there any mention of the implementation or use of a Pass Through Limitation policy? These policies typically aim to address situations where contractors or subcontractors might be charging excessive indirect costs.
